name: Scribe Bigsley

topics.topic_text: Griffon's up to something with the Aqua Pura. What do you know about it?
topics.response_text: Not that it's really any of your business, but we have an arrangement. He buys water, I send him some.

topics.topic_text: I have some questions about the Project Purity operation.
topics.response_text: By all means, I'd love to answer some questions. I've got nothing better to do.{exhausted and sarcastic}

topics.topic_text: Ever think about letting people bring in empty bottles to fill up?
topics.response_text: I'm sure you can imagine the chaos if we just let anyone who wanted to wade into the basin and fill up a jug?{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: Where's Doctor Li?
topics.response_text: Tch. She apparently decided to pursue "more interesting projects" up north in the Commonwealth.{belittling, exhausted}

topics.topic_text: I was going to ask you something but I forgot what it was.
topics.response_text: Yeah, well, when you remember what it was you were going to ask. Take it up with one of the other Scribes, okay? Thanks.{exhausted and done with fools}

topics.topic_text: How long do you think it'll take to purify the basin?
topics.response_text: I don't think anyone really knows the answer to that. Seems to be going rather quickly though.{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: Is it hard bottling all that water? Or is it all done by machines?
topics.response_text: You take a bottle, you dunk it under water, and glug glug glug, it fills up. Amazing.{sarcastic, exhausted and done with fools}

topics.topic_text: So do you know why they call it Aqua Pura?
topics.response_text: Umm... because it's not irradiated. Really? You couldn't work that one out for yourself?{sarcastic, exhausted and done with fools}

topics.topic_text: Let's discuss some other matters.
topics.response_text: <Sigh.>{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: Mind if I ask some questions about your role in all of this?
topics.response_text: Sure. It's not like I'm going to be able to get much done today anyway. Ask away.{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: I'm interested. Continue...
topics.response_text: I started out in the Swords. I upped the output of a few Laser Rifles. Apparently some initiates couldn't handle the extra power. A few got hurt.{exhausted (sarcastically reliving unpleasant memories)}

topics.topic_text: I'm not in the mood for a long story. Never mind.
topics.response_text: Whatever.{exhausted. dismissive.}

topics.topic_text: So how'd you get stuck with this job?
topics.response_text: I follow orders, but I'm not exactly a "yes man." I figure a Scribe's job is to find the devil in the details. Consequently I seldom get promoted.{exhausted and resentful}

topics.topic_text: What's your take on Elder Lyons?
topics.response_text: It's probably best if I don't answer that question.{exhausted, frustrated}

topics.topic_text: So what Order of Scribes are you part of?
topics.response_text: Yeah... that's a long story actually.{exhausted (sarcastically reliving unpleasant memories)}

topics.topic_text: You look pretty tired.
topics.response_text: I literally can't remember the last time I got sleep... I must have dozed off recently though, if the drool on my desk is any indication. <Sigh.>{exhausted, but trying to make a joke}

topics.topic_text: That's all I was curious about.
topics.response_text: <Sigh.>{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry? Who are you?
topics.response_text: Excuse me, I'm Bigsley. And I'm just a tad stressed out. Perhaps you saw that little line outside my door?{mildly apologetic, but exhausted}

topics.topic_text: And a hearty "hello" to you too, jerk.
topics.response_text: Oh, I'm sorry. Was I being rude just now? Maybe I should congratulate you on getting through the door.{sarcastic}

topics.topic_text: I don't know what you're talking about. What's this about a purifier? <Lie.>
topics.response_text: If you want to play make believe, fine. Go right ahead. I've got real problems in the real world to deal with.{annoyed and too busy to be bothered}

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you have your hands full.
topics.response_text: Everyone was so excited about that Purifier: "Project Purity this," and "Project Purity that."{sarcastic}

topics.topic_text: You're not the only one with problems.
topics.response_text: Right. I heard about your dad. Sorry kid. I don't mean to sound unsympathetic, really. But, if you understood the pressure...{sarcastic and unsympathetic}

topics.topic_text: Is there anything I can do to lend a hand?
topics.response_text: Really? Well, there's plenty of things I need help with.{surprised someone offered to help}

topics.topic_text: I wish I could help. But, I don't work for free.
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood didn't always work for free either.{annoyed about the direction his leadership has taken}

topics.topic_text: Not my problem. Good luck with all that.
topics.response_text: Yeah. Whatever. Now leave me alone. I need to think.{annoyed.}

topics.topic_text: How can I help?
topics.response_text: Well, I've got Rivet City water caravans needing help with some "unusually organized" bandits. Need someone to go investigate what that's all about.{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: If I get paid, I might lend a hand. What's the job?
topics.response_text: Hmmm... Well, I have two jobs actually.{sizing up a potential ally}

topics.topic_text: Thought you'd like to know. Griffon's dead.
topics.response_text: He's dead? Greaaaat. I guess I'll just have to find some other way to subsidize the water caravans.{annoyed and disheartened}

topics.topic_text: I know you've got something set up. Don't worry, I won't tell your superiors.
topics.response_text: Yeah, you don't seem like the goody-goody type. But don't spread this around: So this ghoul, Griffon, comes in wanting to PURCHASE a bunch of water.{letting player in on a little secret}

topics.topic_text: So you guys have something set up on the side?
topics.response_text: We do what we can. Take, for example, this ghoul Griffon. He wanted to PURCHASE a bunch of water.{letting player in on a little secret}

topics.topic_text: Did you know Griffon's stashing the Aqua Pura and selling irradiated water?
topics.response_text: He he. I guess he's more clever than I thought.{tired but amused}

topics.topic_text: I think I've found where the Aqua Pura went.
topics.response_text: Don't bother me with the details until you've taken care of the problem. I'm not sending more Aqua Pura until I know it's been handled.

topics.topic_text: I'm not going to help you with Megaton. I've got better things to do.
topics.response_text: I'm a very busy man. I only have time for people who have time for me.{upset, exhausted}

topics.topic_text: I'll see what I can do about Megaton.
topics.response_text: Really? That's great. I'm sorry I can't offer you any support in this. All our resources are tied up at the moment. Good luck.{(exhausted) pleased he's found an ally}

topics.topic_text: As long as I get paid, you'll get your problem solved.
topics.response_text: Of course you'll be paid. Most of our assets have been exhausted by war with the Enclave. But I'm a resourceful fellow. Don't you worry about that.{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: Megaton's destroyed. I suppose their water shipment isn't much of concern now.
topics.response_text: Heard about that. News traveled fast. I couldn't believe it. I mean, everyone knew it was crazy building a city around that bomb...{shocked}

topics.topic_text: Officer Lepelletier said you'd be rewarding me...
topics.response_text: Yes, yes. I received a message from her. It's here somewhere... Well, no matter where it is, I know what it said.{exhausted}

topics.topic_text: Officer Lepelletier is dead.
topics.response_text: What?!{shocked and upset}

topics.topic_text: I'm not a fan of Rivet City or risking my life. Good luck with all that.
topics.response_text: I'm starting to lose my patience with you. If you aren't here to help, then please: leave.{upset, exhausted}

topics.topic_text: I'll see what assistance I can offer Rivet City security.
topics.response_text: Great! Hopefully you can get them straightened out. We really can't do this without them.{exhausted but pleased to find an ally}

topics.topic_text: I'll lend Officer Lepelletier a hand, but fees may be incurred.
topics.response_text: Yes. Yes. Of course you'll be paid. Go see what she needs, lend a hand, take care of whatever their problem is, and you'll have your reward.{exhausted but pleased}

topics.topic_text: Seems like a lot of trouble giving it away. Why don't you just sell the water?
topics.response_text: Many of us keep asking that same question. The Brotherhood isn't a postal service.{frustrated}

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Got to hand it to you kid. That was a brave thing you did, risking your life to start the Purifier.{partly sincere, partly sarcastic}

topics.topic_text: PLAYER KNOCK OVER OBJECTS
topics.response_text: Pardon the mess.{sarcastic, someone knocked over a stack of papers on his messy desk}

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: If I did, I wouldn't tell you. I'm just doing what I'm told to do by Lyons. Even if I don't like doing it.{hiding something}

conversation.response_text: What? Oh yes. I'm just a little tired. What was this about them running into trouble?{startled awake, exhausted}
And...?{as in "yes, get to the point"  exhausted}
Oh? And how was your visit? Did Lyons treat you to tea and biscuits?{sarcastic... exhausted}
Indeed you have. Much improved.{(hiding his sarcasm) exhausted}
And how the hell is that MY problem?{exhausted}
Excellent. Did anyone die?{(asking a routine question) exhausted}
Wonderful. Put them on my desk.{sarcastic, exhausted}
Excellent. I'm glad I don't have to oversee that anymore.{well pleased, but exhausted}
<Grumble>{(signaling "not now, go away!" to underling) low growl, annoyed}
Good. I could use a moment to myself.{exhausted, glad he's going to be left alone for awhile}
I was wondering when you'd show up.{under his breath, annoyed he is being bothered again.}

combat.response_text: Next time do try to be civil. Thank you.{annoyed}
I don't want to have to kill you, but I will!{angry}
What do you think you're doing?{upset, catching a pickpocket}
How dare you!{angry, catching a thief}

description:
Scribe Bigsley is a 45 year-old Caucasian Male.

A competent yet combative Brotherhood of Steel scribe currently serving as the administrator of Project Purity's water distribution network. Known for his abrasive personality and inability to read social cues, Bigsley has been transferred multiple times due to conflicts with superiors who deemed his approach too argumentative.

Scribe Bigsley's Personality: Combative, argumentative, stressed, and overwhelmed. Bigsley is highly competent in his technical abilities but struggles with interpersonal relationships. He believes he's following orders precisely but delivers his corrections in an abrasive manner that creates friction with colleagues. He's nearing a nervous breakdown from the pressures of his position.

Scribe Bigsley's Backstory: Scribe Bigsley began his career in the Brotherhood of Steel with the Order of the Sword, where he modified laser rifles that proved unsafe, injuring several initiates. This resulted in his transfer to the Order of the Shield, where he clashed with Scribe Bowditch over 'antiquated' theories of force field resonance. His combative nature continued in the Order of the Quill, leading to his assignment to field operations. Eventually, he was assigned to Project Purity as head of the water distribution network, where his expertise is needed but his temperament continues to cause problems.
